comments.body: TODO to fix this interface
I saw this anonymous function or a very similar one somewhere else in the pull, right?  Can't re-use?
I can't seem to find what you are referring to.  Better link?

> I can't seem to find what you are referring to. Better link?

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/18835/files#diff-9765b963cad9ecc6ef9416a1f15ded86R197
Actually I think you should use the same function. The one @deads2k pasted looks correct. The one you wrote here seems to have a wrong `ObjectConvertor`.
@brendandburns how about this comment?
expandResourceShortcut(resource) won't work if resource is in the form of "group/kind". Currently you won't pass "group/kind" to this function, so I guess you only need to fix the comment.
Fixed
Please remove the deprecated comment. We forgot to remove it, so we're stuck with it.
should have been plural
Changed to "componentstatuses".
Don't we also support singular shortcuts ?
Link?

$ ./cluster/kubectl.sh get pods
NAME                IMAGE(S)            HOST                LABELS              STATUS

$ ./cluster/kubectl.sh get pod
NAME                IMAGE(S)            HOST                LABELS              STATUS

$ ./cluster/kubectl.sh get po
NAME                IMAGE(S)            HOST                LABELS              STATUS
That last one doesn't work anymore after @smarterclayton's latest change. This change adds it back in.

Without context, what I see is a public function that expands shortcuts
into canonical form, but does not handle all shortcuts, and dopes not
explain why not.

Comment?  don't export?

I am confused; "pod" and "pods" are not shortcuts, only "po" is. What shortcuts does this not handle?

I expanded the comment a little bit.

It's public because it seems like shortcut expansion is generally useful.
Can you move this to RESTMapper so it's behind an interface (expandresource maybe)?  Otherwise it's impossible for anyone to add custom shortcuts
Pondering this. Would you be OK if I defer this to later with a TODO?

It doesn't block downstream since we can live without short forms, so yes.

comments.body: comment on the args here?
Done. Let me know if the style is wrong.
Not sure if better or worse, but it feels like both of these funcs could be replaced with a map[string]string and a simple lookup+report-error function.
Sorry, a map per fucntion (and per target in the above)
OK.

We defined a struct https://github.com/openshift/origin/blob/master/pkg/cmd/client/kubecfg.go#L255 to capture this.  Some of it is dependent on the component plugins work, but the general mapping problem is going to be similar.

> >   I tried this, but it ended up being very duplicative, e.g.:
> 
> resourceMap := map[string]string{
>     "pods": map[string]string{
>         "path": "pods",

> So I switched back. My guess is once this bakes a bit, some form of it will be moved upstream into the client, and we can probably take advantage of some other mappings or data structure in the client package.
